data.description:
Campfire is the best way to communicate 3D information across the physical product lifecycle. Whether you're streamlining design reviews, sales presentations, or technical training, Campfire makes it easier than ever.

A NEW APPROACH Campfire is designed for the way people communicate most naturally – around things. Instead of sharing screenfuls of CAD, images, and text, you share interactive 3D content with your team around it, even if they're around the globe.

EASY TO USE Campfire uses passthrough on Meta Quest to make spatial collaboration feel natural. Content is life-size in front of you, and your colleagues are around it – whether they’re in the same room or joining remotely.

SIMPLE & POWERFUL TOOLS Choose from powerful tools with a single button. Use the laser pointer to make your point. Use text, sketch, and measurement annotations to communicate in meetings or offline. Try tools like slice, explode, and grab, to show complex concepts with simplicity not possible in the physical world.

40+ TYPES OF 3D/CAD Create scenes on Mac, PC, or iPad using your existing CAD/3D files. No coding required. Optimize your models automatically and securely for Meta Quest and iPad for the best experience for all users.

A FREE START Share up to 5 projects with 5 scenes with unlimited users. Create scenes using files up to 25MB in FBX, OBJ, GLB/TF, PLY, STL, and USD/Z/A/C formats. Enterprise plans are available at campfire3d.com.

changelog.change_log:
March 2024
New Features
•	In-Room Collaboration (Quest Preview).  Now multiple Quest users can work on the same project in the same room. Powered by Meta Shared Spatial Anchors, in-room collaboration works seamlessly. To join a project, stand near a colleague and look where they do. You'll be prompted to join if the project has been shared with you.

•	Point-to-Point Measurement (All Platforms). You can now make point-to-point measurements with the Measure tool.  Just point at the locations you want to measure between, and the distance between them appears on a connecting line. Measurements update automatically, so it's easy to evaluate gaps while grabbing and moving parts. And because measurements are annotations, you can share them with links as with text and sketches.

•	Precision Slice (Mac, PC, iPad). We brought the Slice tool to the desktop, so you can create precise cross sections when creating scenes and then move them freely on Quest. On the desktop, you can lock a cutting plane to a particular axis and use the inspector to control position and rotation on all axes. The Slice plane also now appears in the Hierarchy, allowing a presenter to hide/show it.

•	Enhanced VR Experience (Quest)
We've enhanced the visual experience in VR to make it easier to orient yourself relative to the ground and other users.  

•	Easier Access to Materials (All Platforms)
A new section has also been added to Materials tab in the Inspector to make it easier to access general purpose materials.

•	Project List Updates (All Platforms)
All apps now use the tiled project list introduced in the Quest app. Project tiles now include a thumbnail for the first scene, icons for users in the project, and an indicator for whether a project is open nearby (Quest). 
Known Issues
Adding Models (Mac, PC, iPad)
•	Importing multiple large models simultaneously into different scenes may fail with an error notification. Re-import failed models one at a time.
•	If models require external texture files, the external files must be stored locally – they cannot be links to cloud services. 

In-Room Collaboration (Quest Preview)
•	If you don’t see a shared project after a few seconds, you might need to clear the Point Cloud cache on your Quest with the following steps: 1) Navigate to Settings -> Point Cloud -> Delete shared storage, 2) Click on Delete, 3) Create a new room-scale boundary, 4) Restart your device.
•	Room scale content may make the real world and other users impossible to see. Take care not to bump into physical objects, walls, or people. 

Measure
•	Point-to-point measurements can only be made between points on model surfaces. To measure the distance between a model and an arbitrary point in space or on the ground, add a model with a surface at the point in space or on the ground you want to measure to or from (All Platforms)
•	Measurement units cannot be changed from the Measure tool in AR mode (iPad)
•	Cannot resolve or copy a link to Measurement annotations in AR mode. (iPad)

Sharing
•	Campfire links do not open the Quest app. Open projects directly from within the Campfire app. (Quest)
Fixes
•	Fixed issues related to switching between environment and object scenes. 
•	Quest VR mode now has color gradient

New Features & Bug Fixes
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Quest. New user tutorial with Spark has improved tool tips. 

Voice Chat. Fixed connectivity issues when Quest goes to sleep and resumes.

Account creation. Miscellaneous bug fixes and clearer error messages.

Model Optimization. Fixed an issue where occasionally models with sub meshes had mismatched textures when viewed on Quest or iPad.

Known Issues
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sample projects will take up to 5 minutes to appear in a newly created account.

Importing multiple large models simultaneously into different scenes may cause some failures. Re-import the models that failed one at a time.  

Measure tool does not work with animated models on Quest devices .
.
When adding a 3d model that has external texture files, all files must be accessible to Campfire locally, and cannot be links to files on a cloud storage service.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
We hope these updates and improvements will enhance your experience with Campfire. As always, please let us know if you encounter any issues or have any feedback. Thank you for using Campfire!

**New Features**

- Quest. Campfire is now available in the Meta Store for Quest 3, Quest Pro, and Quest 2. Quest 3’s full color passthrough makes collaboration more natural than ever. We’re also introducing a new tutorial led by Spark, a virtual trainer who explains how to use Campfire tools with a little AI flair. The Quest app also brings the scene list, hierarchy, and inspector into your space to make it easy to present and make quick scene edits along the way.
- Voice Chat. Campfire continues to work seamlessly alongside Zoom and Teams meetings, but now you can chat directly in Campfire with the click of a button.
- Library. For enterprise accounts, we’re introducing the library to make it easy to share models between projects and scenes. Add models to the library and use them in any scene or project.
- Measuring Tool. Quickly measure parts or models by selecting them with the measuring tool. A bounding volume will show measurements on each axis.
- Model Optimization. For enterprise accounts, you can turn on model optimization to automatically reduce complexity of large models for use on iPad and Quest.
- Enterprise Admin. For enterprise accounts, admin users can now manage users from a web browser.

**Known Issues**

- Sample projects will take up to 5 minutes to appear in a newly created account
- Occasionally, enterprise users may encounter a texture mismatch when viewing optimized models on Quest or iPad. This may happen on models with sub-meshes. You can toggle compatibility with Quest or iPad OFF, although performance on these devices may not be optimal.
- Editing a comment on Quest will erase all the text instead of starting at the end of the text block.
- Measure tool does not work with animated models on Quest devices
- Occasionally, the project share screen, will not show all the users the project is currently shared with.
- Quest and iPad users may experience disruptions in voice chat if the device are left idle. To resume voice chat, simply leave the project and start it again

We hope these updates and improvements will enhance your experience with Campfire. As always, please let us know if you encounter any issues or have any feedback. Thank you for using Campfire!

Campfire is in preview until Nov 14.  

The preview includes an interactive tutorial and will allow you to create and share scenes on the desktop and iPad, but they will not appear on Quest until Nov 14.
